For what it is, its incredible. Coming from console, there is a huge learning curve when it comes to using a keyboard and mouse for the first time. Especially when it is a tactical game as well. (I wouldn't call COD tactical). Now with quite a few hours into the game I do feel myself getting better at the game, however there is still a lot for me to learn. If you want a game that's entertaining and you don't have much money? Then this is the game to get!

Always wanted a PC to play CS:GO and I got one for it, almost for the game itself literally. Started out on 60 fps, curved monitor and quickly realized that you needed to be on 144hz or higher to be above average. If you are competitive, the game is perfect for you because of how many hours it takes to learn gun patterns, grenade placements, movement, callouts, etc and the skill gaps that come with each one. Not the easiest as a solo player but you can find some decent people to play with in this toxic community(Can be funny or annoying depending on your mood). Competitive is extremely fun and skill based but due to the community, youll probably run into smurfs(Players who are good and use different accounts to play against worse kids), and wont be able to rank up unless you sweat just as hard but this hasnt been an issue too much. Use community workshop maps to warmup and practice. Save up and buy the skins you want as youll probably spend more opening cases for them and knifes, good luck even saving up for one at this point lol Definitely see hackers, mainly in casual, but they have banned over 4 million players in 2019 so far, so I guess thats decent.
Game is great for those who want a truly skillful fps and want to test their skills!
